'''Jackson's Warehouse (also known as Jacksons Warehouse''') is a 19th-century warehouse in the Piccadilly Basin area of Manchester, England.
History
Built in 1836, it was originally called the Rochdale Canal Warehouse. In 1961 it was still in use as a warehouse. In October 1974, it was designated a Grade II* listed building. In 2003 a Â£4.25 million restoration project converted the warehouse into residential accommodation and a restaurant.
See also
*Grade II* listed buildings in Greater Manchester
*Listed buildings in Manchester-M1
